狐の子は頬白: (きつねのこはつらじろ) - (proverb)  the apple doesn't fall far from the tree; the apple never falls far from the tree; fox pups have white cheeks
狐の手袋: (きつねのてぶくろ) - digitalis; foxglove
狐の窓: (きつねのまど) - way of entangling one's hands together to leave a small opening between the middle and ring fingers; fox's window
狐を落とす: (きつねをおとす) - to exorcise a fox spirit (from a person)
狐付き: (きつねつき) - possession by a fox spirit; person possessed by a fox spirit
狐塚: (きつねづか) - foxhole; fox mound; fox earth
狐憑き: (きつねつき) - possession by a fox spirit; person possessed by a fox spirit
狐拳: (きつねけん) - game of chance similar to rock, paper scissors, where the different hand gestures symbolize a fox, a hunter and a village head
狐日和: (きつねびより) - changing weather; fickle weather
狐火: (きつねび) - St. Elmo's fire; will-o'-the-wisp
狐焼: (きつねやき) - cooking (something) to a golden brown; something cooked until it's golden brown
狐狩り: (きつねかり) - fox hunt; fox hunting
狐狸: (こり) - foxes and tanuki; sly fellow/deceiver
狐狸妖怪: (こりようかい) - (yoji) tricksters; deceivers; fey creatures; monsters; goblins
狐疑逡巡: (こぎしゅんじゅん) - (yoji) being in doubt and unable to decide; hesitation and indecision
狐窓: (きつねまど) - small (latticework) window placed up high
狐茄子: (キツネナス) - nipplefruit (Solanum mammosum); apple of Sodom; titty fruit; cow's udder
狐饂飩: (キツネうどん) - udon with deep-fried tofu
狗子仏性: (くしぶっしょう) - "Does a dog have Buddha nature?" (classic Zen koan)
狗子佛性: (くしぶっしょう) - "Does a dog have Buddha nature?" (classic Zen koan)
狗尾草: (エノコログサ) - green foxtail (species of annual grass, Setaria viridis)
狗母魚: (エソ) - lizardfish (any fish of family Synodontidae)
狙いどおり: (ねらいどおり) - according to plan; as planned
狙い澄ます: (ねらいすます) - to take careful aim
狙い目: (ねらいめ) - one's chance; the right time; target; objective
狙い通り: (ねらいどおり) - according to plan; as planned
狙う: (nerau) - mirar em; estar atrás de (algo), de olho em
狛笛: (こまぶえ) - Korean flute (horizontal bamboo flute with six holes; highest-pitched flute used in gagaku)
狡: (こう) - Astúcia, feito astuto, truque ardiloso, jogo sujo; pessoa astuta, sujeito astuto, trapaceiro
狡ける: (ずるける) - to shirk one's duties/to be idle/to play truant; to come loose/to come undone/to get untied
狡兎: (こうと) - smart rabbit; cunning rabbit; nimble rabbit
狡兎三窟: (こうとさんくつ) - (yoji) very shrewd in preparing a means of escape; being very good at escaping danger
狡兎死して走狗烹らる: (こうとししてそうくにらる) - when the enemy is defeated, the victorious soldiers can be killed off; when the nimble rabbit dies, the hunting dog is cooked
狡兎良狗: (こうとりょうく) - (yoji) (from 狡兎死して良狗烹らる)  When the enemy is defeated, the victorious soldiers can be killed off
狡猾老獪: (こうかつろうかい) - (yoji) sly and crafty
狡賢い: (ずるがしこい) - devious; cunning; sly; crafty
狩り: (kari) - hunting; harvesting (ex.: frutas vermelhas, fruta), picking, gathering
狩りバチ: (カリバチ) - hunter wasp (i.e. potter wasp, sand wasp, etc.)
狩り出す: (かりだす) - to hunt out/to flush out/to round up; to impress/to recruit
狩り立てる: (かりたてる) - to flush out (game, etc.)/to drive (animals)/to beat/to hunt down; (駆り立てる, 駆立てる only) to urge/to spur on/to push on/to impel
狩り蜂: (カリバチ) - hunter wasp (i.e. potter wasp, sand wasp, etc.)
狩り集める: (かりあつめる) - to round up; to gather; to muster; to mobilize; to mobilise
狩る: (かる) - to hunt (e.g. animals); to go looking for (e.g. flowers, etc.); to gather (e.g. mushrooms); to pick (e.g. fruit)
狩人蜂: (かりうどばち) - hunter wasp (i.e. potter wasp, sand wasp, etc.)
狩倉: (かりくら) - hunting ground; hunting contest
狩出す: (かりだす) - to hunt out/to flush out/to round up; to impress/to recruit
狩座: (かりくら) - hunting ground; hunting contest
狩猟免許: (しゅりょうめんきょ) - hunting license; hunting licence
狩猟動物: (しゅりょうどうぶつ) - game animal
狩猟採集民: (しゅりょうさいしゅうみん) - hunters and gatherers
狩猟隊: (しゅりょうたい) - safari; troop of hunters
狩競: (かりくら) - hunting ground; hunting contest
狩蜂: (カリバチ) - hunter wasp (i.e. potter wasp, sand wasp, etc.)
狩衣: (かりごろも) - kariginu (informal clothes worn by the nobility from the Heian period onwards); (during the Edo period) patterned kariginu
狩集める: (かりあつめる) - to round up; to gather; to muster; to mobilize; to mobilise
